variant.name: .NoThanks

when the mic button is pressed

histogram.name: Assistant.BetterOnboarding.Click
histogram.summary: The number of times Assistant better onboarding buttons are clicked.

histogram.name: Assistant.BetterOnboarding.Shown
histogram.summary: The number of times Assistant better onboarding UI is shown. The UI has a few different modes recorded in the enum.

histogram.name: Assistant.ButtonClickCount
histogram.summary: The number of times buttons on Assistant UI (e.g., minimize) are clicked.

histogram.name: Assistant.ContextEnabledUserCount
histogram.summary: Among eligible users, whether the user has the Assistant context (related info) enabled. Recorded once for every UMA upload. The set of eligible users includes all users with profiles that can allow Assistant service to be enabled (AssistantAllowedState is limited by locale, policy, etc).

histogram.name: Assistant.DspHotwordDetection
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times Dsp hotword gets detected in each status, to help capture the hotword false acceptance rate.

histogram.name: Assistant.EntryPoint
histogram.summary: Record the Assistant entry point where Assistant UI becomes visible. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Assistant.ExitPoint
histogram.summary: Record the Assistant exit point where Assistant UI becomes invisible. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Assistant.HotwordEnableNotification
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times user click the hotword enable notification to open Assistant settings.

histogram.name: Assistant.Interaction.Resolution
histogram.summary: Record the Assistant interaction resolution code. It indicates how the Assistant server interpreted a particular query and decision on the state, e.g. if the conversation is normal or timed out or ended with other errors.

histogram.name: Assistant.OptInFlow.GetSettingsRequestTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time between get settings request and response. The request will be sent for each time the Assistant OptIn Flow is triggered to get string texts from the server.

histogram.name: Assistant.OptInFlow.LoadingTimeoutCount
histogram.summary: Number of times that the loading timeout triggers. The loading timeout is set by the Assistant OptIn Flow loading screen, which shows up during the server string texts and webviews are pending.

histogram.name: Assistant.OptInFlowStatus
histogram.summary: Record the status of the Assistant opt-in flow.

histogram.name: Assistant.QueryCountPerEntryPoint
histogram.summary: Number of queries fired for each entry point.

histogram.name: Assistant.QueryResponseType
histogram.summary: The Assistant query response type.

histogram.name: Assistant.QuerySource
histogram.summary: The source of Assistant query (e.g. dialog plate text field, voice input). Recorded when the query is committed.

histogram.name: Assistant.ServiceEnabledUserCount
histogram.summary: Among eligible users, whether the user has the Assistant service enabled. Recorded once for every UMA upload. The set of eligible users includes all users with profiles that can allow Assistant service to be enabled (AssistantAllowedState is limited by locale, policy, etc).

histogram.name: Assistant.ServiceReadyTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time between when the Assistant service is launched, and when the Assistant back-end signals it is ready to process queries.

histogram.name: Assistant.ServiceStartTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time spent in starting Assistant service.

histogram.name: Assistant.SetDspHotwordLocale
histogram.summary: For each attempt to set the hotword locale for a DSP device, counts whether the attempt succeeded.

histogram.name: Assistant.VoiceSearch.AgsaVersion{Timing}
histogram.summary:
(Android only) Reports the current Agsa version on the device. The version is reported as described in GSAState#parseAgsaMajorMinorVersionAsInteger.
This is reported {Timing}.

histogram.name: Assistant.VoiceSearch.ConsentOutcome
histogram.summary: (Android only) Reports the outcome of the consent dialog shown for the assistant.

histogram.name: Assistant.VoiceSearch.UserEligibility.FailureReason{Timing}
histogram.summary:
(Android only) Reports why users failed the eligibility check for the feature.
Before M90, this histogram only reported the FailureReason which failed the eligibility check. If a client failed for multiple reasons, some would be ignored.
From M90 onwards, this will report all FailureReasons that effect eligibility.
This is reported {Timing}.

histogram.name: Assistant.VoiceSearch.UserEligibility{Timing}
histogram.summary:
(Android only) Reports user eligibility for Assistant voice search. This is reported even when the feature is disabled.
This is reported {Timing}.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.ActiveImpression
histogram.summary: For quick answer impression that fulfills a user's intent, records the result type. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.ActiveImpression.Duration{QuickAnswersClickResultType}
histogram.summary: For quick answer impression that fulfills a user's intent, records the impression duration. ChromeOS only. {QuickAnswersClickResultType}

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Click
histogram.summary: For every quick answer click event, records the result type. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Click.Duration{QuickAnswersClickResultType}
histogram.summary: For every quick answer click event, records the duration between fetch finish and user clicks. ChromeOS only. {QuickAnswersClickResultType}

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Consent
histogram.summary: For every quick answers consent impression, records how many times the user has seen the consent. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.ContextMenu.Close
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the user interacted (via clicking) with a context menu, whether or not that menu included any Quick Answers. Recorded when the menu is closed. This metric can be used as a baseline for Quick Answers engagement metrics, which record whether users click on context menus that *do* include a Quick Answers card. Recorded on ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.ContextMenu.Close.Duration{InteractionType}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the context menu was shown before close if the user {InteractionType} (via clicking) with the context menu. Recorded on ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.ExitPoint
histogram.summary: Record the Quick Answers exit point point when the Quick Answers UI is dismissed. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Intent
histogram.summary: For quick answer fetch, records the intent generated on-device. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Loading.Duration
histogram.summary: For every quick answers fetch, records the duration between fetch start and fetch finish. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Loading.Status
histogram.summary: For every quick answers fetch, records the result status. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.NetworkError.IntentType
histogram.summary: Records the intent type when network error occurs during the quick answers fetch. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.RequestTextLength.{IntentType}
histogram.summary: For every quick answer request, records the length of the selected text that is being used for fetching {IntentType} results. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Result
histogram.summary: For every quick answer result received event, records the result type. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.Result.Duration{QuickAnswersClickResultType}
histogram.summary: For every quick answer result received event, records the duration between fetch start and fetch finish. ChromeOS only. {QuickAnswersClickResultType}

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.SelectedContent.Length
histogram.summary: For every quick answer request, records the length of the selected text that is being considered for fetching quick answers. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.V2.Consent
histogram.summary: For every quick answers consent impression, records how many times the user has seen the consent. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: QuickAnswers.V2.Consent.Duration{QuickAnswersV2ConsentResultType}
histogram.summary: For every quick answers consent result event, records how long the user has seen the consent before. ChromeOS only. {QuickAnswersV2ConsentResultType}
